meanings.definition: To move or act in a clumsy or ineffectual manner.
meanings.sent1: She tried to pudder through the dance routine, but kept tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The toddler began to pudder around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent3: Watching the penguin pudder on the ice was both adorable and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The old car puddered down the road, barely making any progress.
meanings.sent5: The robot puddered along the assembly line, making mistakes at every turn.

meanings.definition: A person who is incompetent or ineffective.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was a complete pudder, unable to complete any task correctly.
meanings.sent2: The manager realized he had hired a pudder when nothing was getting done on time.
meanings.sent3: The pudder in the office always managed to mess up the simplest of tasks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a pudder among the skilled professionals in the team.
meanings.sent5: The pudder's mistakes were becoming a burden on the entire team.

meanings.sent1: He added a pudder of sugar to his coffee to sweeten it just a bit.
meanings.sent2: A pudder of sand had collected at the bottom of the hourglass.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled a pudder of herbs on top of the dish for added flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a pudder of paint to create delicate brush strokes.
meanings.sent5: A pudder of snow had settled on the branches, creating a picturesque scene.
